product_overview: Lumen is a centralized platform enabling students to submit and track academic achievements, faculty to efficiently review and manage these submissions, and administrators to oversee users, analytics, and system configurations. It supports multiple roles including Student, Faculty, Admin, and SuperAdmin with secure authentication and role-based access control, enhancing institutional management and student engagement through advanced tracking, reporting, and communication features.
core_goals: Create a unified platform for academic achievement submission and review across multiple user roles.
Reduce administrative overhead by automating activity tracking, approvals, and reporting.
Provide data-driven insights to improve student engagement and institutional performance.
Ensure secure and compliant management of user data with robust authentication and role management.
Deliver a seamless and accessible user experience across devices with responsive design.
key_features: Multi-role authentication system integrated with Clerk supporting Students, Faculty, Admin, and SuperAdmin roles.
Student dashboard for activity submissions, certificate uploads, status tracking, and profile management.
Faculty portal for reviewing submissions with feedback, bulk approvals, and student oversight tools.
Admin dashboard for user management, system analytics, reporting, and configuration.
SuperAdmin controls for advanced system oversight and database management.
Comprehensive analytics with interactive charts and multi-format report exports including PDF via jsPDF.
Role-based navigation and route protection using React Router.
Real-time data persistence and updates using Supabase integration.
Reusable UI components styled with Tailwind CSS and Radix UI for consistency and accessibility.
Robust testing infrastructure with Vitest and Testing Library to ensure quality and reliability.
user_flow_summary: Students access the dashboard to submit activities via a multi-step form with file uploads and can track the review status in real time.
Faculty review pending student submissions using filters, provide approvals or rejections with comments, and monitor review history.
Administrators manage user accounts with advanced search, role assignments, and bulk actions while analyzing institution-wide activity data through dashboards.
SuperAdmins oversee system health, manage cross-institutional users, perform backups, and monitor security events via a master dashboard.
Users navigate through role-specific interfaces with secure session management and guided onboarding workflows including profile completion and role verification.
validation_criteria: Authentication must securely handle login, logout, password recovery, and support multi-factor authentication.
Role-based access control should enforce feature permissions and route protections according to user roles.
Student activity submissions require validation for file types, sizes (max 5MB), and data fields before acceptance.
Faculty review workflows must log all actions with audit trails and provide notification of status changes to students.
Admin and SuperAdmin dashboards must display accurate analytics and allow complete user lifecycle management without errors.
UI components should be responsive, accessible (WCAG 2.1 AA), and consistent across all roles and devices.
System performance requirements include page loads under 2 seconds and API responses averaging below 500ms under load.
Testing coverage must meet a minimum of 80% with critical paths covered at 95%, verified through automated unit and integration tests.
Security compliance must include encryption, RLS policies, input sanitization, and adherence to FERPA, GDPR, and other regulations.
